result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian F Stoll Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brian F. Stoll in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:12 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

There is a plea agreement in this matter.

Defendant is pleading to Count 1. Counts 2-4 will be dismissed and read in. State recommends a joint recommendation: Impose/stay 120 day jail, 12 mo prob concurrent, rest: $480, costs, no con Phils Bar, comply with all other conditions in other probations.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Misdemeanor Theft
Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
Count 3: Dismissed and Read In
Count 4: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Cousins addresses the Court prior to sentencing, this is a joint recommendation. 
State has complied with victim notification statutes. State provides to the Court a copy of the restutition summary as well as a copy to Defense.
Atty Drengler addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court questions Defendant regarding payment of restitution. Defendant is on a payment plan with his agent right now for court costs, $20 per month. Defendant states he can pay the $480 within 12 months. 

Court believes the plea agreement is fair and appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 120 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period of 12 Months, Concurrent to probation that Defendant is currently serving
Conditions:
Pay restitution in the amount of $480, to be paid first
Pay costs, to be paid during period of probation
No contact with Fill's Bar
Plea hearing on July 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Ryan W Drengler in court. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

10:40 am. Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.

BTC:
Not Guilty plea entered.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian F. Stoll in court with attorney Ryan W Drengler. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Intern Taylor Kraus also appears.

2:02 PM Court calls case.
Intern Kraus states appearances.

This matter was set for a pretrial, Defendant failed to appear, bench warrant was ordered.

Atty Drengler is appearing voluntarily in front of this Court. Defendant is surrendering voluntarily.

BY THE COURT:
Warrant is quashed.

Atty Drengler addresses the Court, there was a miscommunication of the pretrial date.

State requests that the bond be continued.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is continued.

Court advises Defendant to pay attention to court dates.

  Arraignment scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Attorney Ryan W Drengler in court. ADA Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant fails to appear:  BTC: Bench Warrant w/$500 cash bond alternative.
Pre-trial conference on June 23, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Court calls case at 3:28 p.m. Defendant Brian F. Stoll in court with attorney Ryan W Drengler. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 12, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
BTC:  $1,000 sig bond: No contact with Phil's Bar or any of its employess

Defendant Brian F. Stoll in court with attorney Ryan W Drengler. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties. in Steven Point
BTC: 
BTC:  $1,000 sig bond: No contact with Phil's Bar or any of its employess  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
